title: 111_hr3901
content: The "Homebuyer Tax Credit Improvement Act of 2009" enhances the administration of the first-time homebuyer tax credit. The "Homebuyer Tax Credit Improvement Act of 2009" introduces an age limitation for the tax credit on home purchases, requiring taxpayers to be at least 18 years old. Married taxpayers can meet this requirement if either spouse meets the age criteria. Additionally, documentation requirements are specified in the Act. Married taxpayers can meet this requirement if either spouse meets the age criteria. Documentation requirements are also specified in the Act, including the need to attach a properly executed copy of the settlement statement used for the purchase to the tax return. Additionally, there is a restriction on married individuals acquiring a residence from the family of their spouse. Additionally, errors related to claiming the first-time homebuyer tax credit are treated as mathematical or clerical errors under certain conditions.
